job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Performance and Rewards (P&R) Department drives a high performance culture which focuses HPB’s diverse workforce to deliver on desired performance and behaviours aligned to HPB values.  To effectively attract, engage and retain HPB’s talents, we design and implement holistic and market competitive rewards strategies.  We also cultivate a harmonious and collaborative union-management partnership and drive productivity improvements through process improvements, technology and the revamped HRIS.    Responsibilities The successful candidate will lead Performance and Rewards team and report to the Director of Human Resources and Organisation Development.  Specifically, the responsibilities will include:  Develop a robust performance management strategy to drive desired performance and behaviours aligned to HPB’s value Drive a holistic and effective compensation and benefits strategy (compensation, benefits, work-life effectiveness and career development) that attracts and retains different staff segments Leverage technology to streamline work processes and drive the implementation of the revamped HRIS to enhance productivity Drive the adoption of HR data analytic tools to shape and track the effectiveness of HR strategies Cultivate a harmonious and collaborative union-management partnership Drive compliance and capacity building for Public Service/HPB’s code of conduct           Requirements  At least 5 years’ of experience in leading a team; At least 10 years’ of experience handling key HR functions especially performance management, compensation, industrial relations and HRIS; He/She would ideally be a highly motivated strategic and systems thinker, comfortable with systems and data; He/She should have good EQ and influencing skills, the maturity and strength to do the right thing and possess a continuous improvement mindset.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesCore Responsibilities

You will be working with a team of Scientists as well as supervise a team of Laboratory Officers to manage the forensic analysis of drug exhibits submitted by the law enforcement agencies. Based on the various scientific results gathered, you will interpret the data and issue formal reports.  When necessary, you will also give evidence in court as an expert witness to testify on the scientific process of analysis.
You will also conduct research in new analytical methods for the identification of unknowns as well as perform structural elucidation using techniques such as NMR, LC/MS/MS, QTOF and IR. Application of multi variant data analysis for research is also expected.

Experiences

At least 2 years of experience in using analytical equipment such as LC, GC and GCMS.
Strong in multivariate statistical analysis, with experience in applying principal component analysis, ANOVA, linear discriminant analysis, or clustering analysis to real life examples
Familiar with software such as R, Python, SPSS, SAS, Unscrambler or MatLab
Relevant experience in structural elucidation of unknowns using techniques such as NMR, LC/MS/MS, QTOF and IR. 
Excellent English skills in writing scientific papers and giving oral presentation
Able to work independently with a good sense of team spirit
Meticulous with passion for analytical work
Innovative and strong critical thinking

job_description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesSuccessful candidate will be part of the Incident Response Team that manages and investigates cyber security incidents. You are required to perform initial assessment of an incident, update stakeholders and resolve the incident in a timely manner. You are also required to collect evidences using forensic methods, recover hidden or deleted data and perform analysis to identify the root cause of an incident.
What to expect:

Assess cyber security threats and vulnerabilities
Ensure timely response to reported incidents
Coordinate incident response effort among various teams
Prepare and review incident reports to update stakeholders
Perform initial investigation to determine potential compromise
Acquire evidence using forensic methods
Perform in-depth investigation to determine the root cause of an incident
Write technical reports detailing the root cause analysis
Provide recommendations to prevent occurrence of similar incidents
Develop and improve processes for incident response and digital forensics

How to succeed:

At least possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Information Security or equivalent
Preferably 5-8 years of Information Security experience
Understanding of operating systems and platform (e.g. Windows, Linux)
Knowledge of networking concept (e.g. LAN/WAN routing, TCP/IP)
Knowledge of adversary tools and techniques (e.g., malwares, bruteforce attacks, buffer overflows, browser attacks, phishing, DNS poisoning)
Familiarity with file systems  (e.g. FAT32, NTFS, EXT4)
Knowledge of forensic tools and techniques (e.g. FTK, Encase)
Familiarity with good security practices
Possess good communication and interpersonal skills
Singapore Citizen only

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe mission statement for the Procurement Department is to be seen as a strategic partner in achieving HPB’s commitment and success, and not just dealing with purchasing matters. The function reports to the CEO.
 
Procurement is responsible to develop sourcing strategies across all indirect spend categories in achieving process efficiency and cost efficacy while ensuring that HPB operates within a proper legal and governance framework. 
 
You will be part of the strategic team to provide direction for (i) sourcing strategy, (ii) policy and governance, (iii) category spend management, (iv) contract and supplier management, (v) cross-functional stakeholders’ collaboration and (vii) procurement operations; using high degree of strategic thinking, influencing and judgement skills. 
 
Responsibilities
You will be responsible in leading sourcing strategy for the assigned spend category (ranging from technology services, marketing services, professional services, healthcare services, facilities services and program & outreach services), optimizing the procurement needs of stakeholders while ensuring that HPB leverages its overall purchasing power. A significant portion of HPB spending will be impacted through these strategic sourcing initiatives and stakeholder partnership, leading to savings & efficiencies for the Board.
 
The role requires the candidate to demonstrate the ability to 
a) re-market the procurement brand from a transactional focus to one that creates value and delivers results, 
b) perform market sourcing and pro-actively engage to influence the stakeholders to achieve better sourcing decisions, 
c) integrate data analytics with business needs to formulate effective sourcing strategies and maximize the return on investment and 
d) effectively leverage the digital technology in discovering the game-changing procurement innovations. 
 
You will be required to also leverage on supplier relationship to gather market leading indicators, new innovations and other important industry insights, including screening all procurement approvals for correctness of submission, procedures and documentation. 
 
Requirements
• Min 10 years of relevant and quality working experience
• Procurement category expertise in Technology and/or Marketing services are preferred
• Advanced project management, contract management, risk analysis, relationship management and supplier selection & development skills
• Advanced working knowledge of: developing sourcing strategies, governance policies and procedures, and streamline operational procedures 
• Knowledge in the Government Procurement Instruction Manuals, GeBIZ and SAP 
• Strong oral and written communication skills. Excellent interpersonal skills to manage different levels of internal stakeholders
• Able to manage workload and priorities in a fast paced and demanding environment
• Proactive, impactful, reliable & passionate individual with ability to influence management

company_name: Maritime And Port Authority Of Singapore
job_description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs part of the IT Corporate Systems team, you will develop and manage the smooth delivery of quality IT corporate systems to support to meet business's requirements of MPA and the shipping community. You will also manage the daily operations of the IT corporate systems to ensure smooth and efficient user operations. As part of the systems development process, you will manage the IT systems integrators and oversee the contract programmers. You are also required to understand the IT management policy, quality management policy as well as security guidelines to ensure that the development processes, procedures and systems are designed in compliance to these policies and guidelines.
To support MPA’s systems, you will interface with vendors to ensure technical compatibility and business sustainability on infrastructure and application systems integration.  You will also be responsible to ensure timely resolution of systems problems to ensure optimal IT performance at all times. You are required to oversee systems implementation including data migration.
You should have a degree in Computer Science or related disciplines. You should possess at least 5 years of experience in systems analysis, implementation, testing, integration, project and vendor management as well as systems support/ maintenance. Prior experience in HR or Finance systems would be preferred. You should also be competent in SAP or PeopleSoft systems. You should be highly self-motivated, capable of working independently and technically competent in carrying out tasks.
Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities
You will work with various stakeholders (business clusters, land planner, architects, engineers, facility managers) within JTC and Government agencies to plan, design and develop new industrial estates for JTC.
To ensure the estates’ visions are met, you will conduct/participate in brainstorming, data gathering, evaluation and implementation of the innovative initiatives in new industrial estates.   You will also be the driver to design and develop the new estates and provide useful information like project brief to guide the team members in implementing the work.
As the project manager, you will represent JTC and manage the consultant and contractor to ensure JTC interests are safeguarded. This includes:

resolve technical and design issues with consultants and contractors,
coordinate with government agencies on any development issue,
identify potential construction related issues or /and contractual disputes and provide appropriate solution,
ensure a quality tender documents with all necessary requirements,
deliver the buildings and infrastructure on time and in an economical way, and
other necessary administrative works for the development

Requirements 
Background in Civil Engineering, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering, preferably with at least 5 years of relevant working experience in consultant or contractor firms, or developer organizations.  Relevant local experience in building and infrastructure construction, including deep excavation and underground works will be favourable.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesInfo-communications Media Development Authority (www.imda.gov.sg) offers a rewarding career that gives you a front seat in the fast-changing infocomm media sector, where technology and content are shaping the way people view the world more than ever. We offer a wide range of opportunities, where talented individuals and teams can make a difference. Whether you are developing a telecommunications policy affecting consumers or spearheading a scheme to nurture budding media talents, each member of IMDA contributes towards driving innovation, enhancing productivity for economic growth, and improving the quality of life for all Singaporeans. As a statutory board in the Ministry of Communications and Information, IMDA promotes and regulates the infocomm and media sectors.   Executive Manager/Senior Manager (Legal Policy), Research & Advocacy/Data Innovation & Protection Group The Data Innovation & Protection Group oversees the adoption of data-driven technologies such as data analytics and AI, and building a sustainable data ecosystem in Singapore. Under the Data Innovation & Protection Group, the Personal Data Protection Commission serves as the principal authority in the area of personal data protection in Singapore, its functions include formulating and implementing policies, regulations and guidelines relating to the protection of personal data. The Data Innovation & Protection Group also supports the Advisory Council on the Ethical Use of AI and Data, which has been established to examine ethical and data governance issues relating to the commercial deployment of data-driven technologies such as AI and Big Data in Singapore. The Council will advise the Government on areas relating to responsible development and deployment of AI, and provide guidance to businesses to minimise ethical and sustainability risks and any adverse impact on consumers arising from the use of data. Responsibilities: ·       Formulate and review policy positions (including legal and regulatory policies), frameworks and strategies relating to AI and data, ethics and the protection of personal data ·       Conduct legal and policy discussions, engagements and consultations with stakeholders (e.g. public, industry, government agencies) and address stakeholder feedback in the review and formulation of strategies, regulatory policies and frameworks ·       Undertake horizon scanning, research and analyses on current and emerging trends and developments in the area of AI and data analytics, regulatory policies and technologies relating to AI and data, ethics and the protection of personal data ·       Coordinate and execute key initiatives by the Advisory Council on the Ethical Use of AI and Data. This includes planning the Council’s agenda, preparing discussion and background papers for the Council’s deliberation, providing regular updates and reports to the Council, and drafting recommendations, guidelines and codes of practice to be issued by the Council ·       Engage key stakeholders and drive advocacy of Singapore’s thought leadership on issues, proposals and recommendations relating to data, the protection of personal data, and the ethical use of AI and data via key local and international platforms ·       Drive strategic research collaborations with key partners and organisation of events/seminars under the Research Programme on Governance of AI and Data Use   Requirements: ·       Masters or bachelor’s degree in any relevant discipline (e.g., economics, sociology, philosophy, law, political science, computer science, technology studies) ·       At least 5-7 years of experience in government policy formulation and research, preferably in technology-related fields such as AI and data technologies ·       Strong aptitude and interest in ethics, data science and technologies ·       Track record of advocacy work and ability to represent the IMDA at conferences both locally and overseas ·       Strong planning and project management skills, able to prioritise tasks to meet tight deadlines while maintaining high standard of accuracy and attention to details ·       Excellent writing and communication skills and ability to engage various stakeholders ·       Self-driven, able to work independently as well as in a team   Position will commensurate with experience.Only short-listed candidates will be notified.
job_title: Executive Manager / Senior Manager (Legal Policy), Research & Advocacy / Data Innovation & Protection Group

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities The overall job purpose of this role is to implement the overall management, commercial marketing and commercial leasing of Marina Float and Management of Managing Agent for The Rink @ JCube by handling day to day works that can improve the utilisation and revenue of The Float and The Rink. job_description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesWith the Cybersecurity landscape today constantly evolving with new threats and vulnerabilities, many organizations are at risk, or have already been compromised. Do you want to play a critical role in defending our Smart Nation against such threats?
 
Cyber Security Group’s Red team is looking for talented engineers who bring fresh ideas and perspectives to join our growing team. We build revolutionary products that significantly enhance the security capabilities within the Government. Our products need to handle data at scale, cross platforms and extend beyond the traditional mind-set of how software should be. 
As part of an agile team, we participate in daily stand-ups, share ideas and have an open communications culture to push the boundaries of the technology that we build. 
 
What to expect:


Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables


How to succeed:


Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming language
Experience working with one or more from the following: 

Web application development
Unix/Linux environments
Kernel driver development
Big data software systems
Security software development




Pluses+:


Strong in programming and scripting languages such as C/C++ and Python
Familiar with front-end development (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap)
Familiar with back-end development (C/C++, Java, Python, PHP, Django)
Familiar with database foundations, and familiar with database technologies such as MySQL and PostgreSQL
Interest and ability to learn coding languages and cybersecurity concepts as needed

job_description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are seeking a Infrastructure Cyber Security Specialist to join our Secured Infrastructure Programme Office (SIPO) that strategises and delivers Whole-of-Government (WOG) infrastructure services as well as the implementation of secure services.
As a Cyber Security Specialist, you will be collaborating with a team of highly motivated peers to implement and maintain enterprise security infrastructures. Success in the role will be demonstrated by your ability to plan and explore new technologies, and up-to-date knowledge on the various security technologies.
What to expect:

Lead implementation of enterprise security infrastructures which includes Contractor management, design validation and test acceptance.
Perform maintenance on the enterprise security infrastructures that covers service and security posture upkeep.       
Develop correlation rules in Security Information Event Management (SIEM) system to detect anomalies or security threats through monitoring.
Escalate security incident alert to respective system owner and assist in containment and recovery from the security incident.
Perform vulnerability assessment using automated tools and recommend actionable follow up to remediate the vulnerabilities and/or threats uncovered
Plan and participate in areas of security operations to ensure that processes meet defined information security policies and standards, and evolving security threats.
Lead and manage security assessments of system that include configuration review, vulnerability scanning and penetration testing.
Provide security consultancy in area of threat and risk assessment throughout the system lifecycle from implementation to maintenance. 

How to succeed:

Experience in management, deployment and maintenance of security infrastructure 
Experience in enterprise data centre operations, information security office, security consultancy and security operation an advantage
Experience in effectively managing contractors and work in cross functional teams
Up-to-date knowledge on the various security technologies
Bachelor's degree computer science, information systems or related field.
Security Certifications like CISA, GSEC, CISSP an advantage
Experience  in public sector technical writing and procurement processes an advantage
Good interpersonal and presentation skills, collaborative and self-directed
Lead implementation of enterprise security infrastructures which includes Contractor management, design validation and test acceptance.
Singapore citizen only

company_location: Mapletree Business City, 10 Pasir Panjang Road 117438
job_description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for a passionate Infrastructure Architect with a focus on Infrastructure Automation. The successful candidate will design and architect the infrastructure automation platform, establish CI/CD release pipeline processes and provide technical consultation in the area of infrastructure automation code development. He/she should have prior training and working experience in the area of automation, building and maintaining a code development environment data manipulation, modelling and visualization.
 
What to Expect: 
 

Develop and maintain the IT infrastructure automation framework for developer to adhere when developing the code as part of CI/CD release pipeline
Establish and maintain the CI/CD release pipeline processes; including testing, development, integration, and configuration management
Design and architect the infrastructure automation platform in automating the IT infrastructure systems and services with the following key components:

Workflow automation
System and network automation via configuration management tools
Code automation to support Infrastructure-as-a-Code
Automated testing & code promotion
Secured code package and source-code download


Evaluate and define the API integration and monitoring mechanism in ensuring the reliability and performance of the orchestration integration across automation components such as ServiceNow, Jira, Bamboo, Bitbucket
Define and maintain the IT infrastructure automation blueprint to provide the roadmap for the release of automation code and achieve the cost saving from automation and process improvement

Identify the manual processes and define the task to be included as part of automation blueprint supporting operation efficiency
Study production infrastructure and application monitoring & logging systems to help identify root causes for event-driven automation
Regular collaboration with service leads to drive process improvements related to configuration management


Setup and maintain the CI/CD and configuration management infrastructure in POC lab to implement and enhance the following automation:

Automate the deployment and provisioning of servers and appliances
Automate the enforcement of hardening and compliance check
Implement security patch management automation


Interact with stakeholders to understand and translate requirements into an appropriate data structure, workflow and code, using best practice solutions
Provide technical consultation/support in IT infrastructure automation code development and deliver training in configuration and release management to service leads and vendors

 
How to Succeed: 

Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or related disciplines
Working experience in programming with the following languages:

Python
Ruby
JavaScript
PowerShell / Bash / Batch scripting


Experience in building and maintaining a code development environment including source control, continuous integration, team management tool, artefact management, and continuous deployment technologies with CI/CD toolset such as Jira stack
Experience in deploying and managing IT infrastructure systems with configuration management tools such as Ansible, Chef or Puppet
Understanding of workflow-based application design patterns in ITSM platform such as ServiceNow
Understanding of Agile work practices / ITIL
Good understanding in servers and network technologies and operations
